name: dm-azure-doppler
description: Use a doppler.com service token to prepare a build or release pipeline in Azure DevOps.
author: DigitalMakers

inputs.name: serviceToken
inputs.label: Doppler Service Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Log into your Doppler.com account, go to the config you want, and generate a Service Token. This token gives the task context and authentication for a project, stage, and config. They are neat.

inputs.name: runFileProcessing
inputs.label: Reconstruct *_BASE64 secrets using their corresponding *_FILENAME setting.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, any secret keys that end with _BASE64 will be base64 decoded and named using the value of a corresponding *_FILENAME key. This supports writing to paths relative to the Working Directory.

inputs.name: runEnvCreation
inputs.label: Make a .env file using the secrets available.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, this task will create a .env file in the root of the Working Directory. It's not really the point of Doppler, so try not to need this...

inputs.name: clearEnvFile
inputs.label: Delete any .env file already in the repo first
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, this first delete an existing .env file in the root of the Working Directory. Only does so if .env writing is enabled above.

inputs.name: setAzureEnvs
inputs.label: Set Azure pipeline environment based on Doppler config
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will set all the environment variables for tasks in the pipeline, based on the provided Doppler config. It will overwrite any that exist already. This runs during the pre-execution phase.
